intro: Tubella inaequisepala, commonly known as the unequal-sepal tubella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that typically display a range of colors, including white, blue, and purple. The plant features showy sepals that are unequal in size, a distinctive trait that aids in its identification. Native to certain regions of South America, it thrives in moist, temperate environments. Its botanical structure includes a slender stem and lance-shaped leaves, making it a notable species within its family.
